page.title: 05A MODERN FARM, BEER
page.content: This dairy farm is worked by three people; the farmer, his wife and one employee. The 100 acres have been farmed for 500 years. 100 cows and 30 calves are kept on the land which formerly supported just 20 cows. There is a milking parlour where 10 cows are milked at once. The milk is stored in a bulk tank until collected daily by a tanker for the Milk Marketing Board. A computer monitors the cows' health and feeding, issuing the correct amount of feed to ensure maximum milk yield. The computer recognises each cow by a collar worn on its neck. The farmer would like more cows, but his milk quota from the European Economic Community prevents this. Formerly cereal crops were grown, but now the land is sown and fertilised grassland used for pasture, with some hay being made, but it is mainly cut for silage.
